Token.Abstract: TMX Tiles of a tile layer. This is just a list of GIDs pointing to a specific tile in the tileset. The GIDs have the KTTilemapTileFlip flags encoded, so it is recommended to use the tileAt method from KTTilemapLayer instead of accessing the GIDs directly.
the memory buffer containing a layer's tile GIDs.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the memory buffer containing a layer's tile GIDs.

Token.Abstract: the memory buffer containing a layer's tile GIDs.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the memory buffer containing a layer's tile GIDs.

Token.Abstract: the memory buffer containing a layer's tile GIDs.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the memory buffer containing a layer's tile GIDs.

Token.Abstract: the size (in bytes) of the GID memory buffer. Equal to (mapSize.width mapSize.height sizeof(gid_t)).

ReturnValue.Abstract: the size (in bytes) of the GID memory buffer. Equal to (mapSize.width mapSize.height sizeof(gid_t)).

ReturnValue.Abstract: the size (in bytes) of the GID memory buffer. Equal to (mapSize.width mapSize.height sizeof(gid_t)).

Token.Abstract: the number of GIDs in the GID memory buffer. Equal to (mapSize.width * mapSize.height).

ReturnValue.Abstract: the number of GIDs in the GID memory buffer. Equal to (mapSize.width * mapSize.height).

Token.Abstract: the number of GIDs in the GID memory buffer. Equal to (mapSize.width * mapSize.height).

ReturnValue.Abstract: the number of GIDs in the GID memory buffer. Equal to (mapSize.width * mapSize.height).

Token.Abstract: Takes an already allocated GID buffer with the given bufferSize (in bytes) and takes ownership for it. Which means: you should not free() the tiles buffer, it will be freed by KTTilemapLayerTiles when it deallocates.

Parameter.Name: tiles
Parameter.Abstract: A pointer to a member buffer containing tile GIDs.

Parameter.Name: bufferSize
Parameter.Abstract: The size of the buffer in bytes.
